title.description: Short, descriptive name of the problem. Do not speculate or hallucinate; use only information directly supported by evidence or source material.

summary.description: Brief description of the problem. Avoid unsupported assumptions or hallucinations; summarize only what is known and evidenced.

evidence.description: Key facts, observations, or code references showing the problem exists. Do not invent evidence; only include verifiable and directly supported information.

description.description: Description of the evidence. Avoid speculation or unsupported claims.

reference.description: Optional file path, line numbers, or URL. Only include if directly relevant and accurate.

implications.description: Consequences or risks if the problem is not fixed. Do not speculate beyond what is supported by the evidence provided.

example.description: Short reproducible example or scenario. Do not fabricate examples; use only real, directly relevant scenarios.

impact.description: Scope or severity of the problem. Avoid exaggeration or minimization; base the impact on factual evidence.

next_steps.description: Optional suggested actions. Only suggest actionable, realistic steps that are supported by the context; do not hallucinate solutions.

items.description: Actionable, realistic next step. Avoid unsupported or speculative suggestions.
